thread.title: Oman- BankDhofar posts 10% growth in H1 net profit to RO22.63mn
thread.title_full: Oman- BankDhofar posts 10% growth in H1 net profit to RO22.63mn | MENAFN.COM

author: Muscat Daily
title: Oman- BankDhofar posts 10% growth in H1 net profit to RO22.63mn
text:
(MENAFN - Muscat Daily) BankDhofar on Tuesday released its official financial statements for the six months period ended June 30 2015 reporting a 10.39 per cent growth in net profit.  Net Profit of the bank increased to RO22.63mn in the first half of this year as compared to RO20.50mn during the same period of 2014.
In a press release BankDhofar said it has continued to show
significant growth in all areas during the first half of 2015 with the total assets increased to RO3.39bn at the end of June 2015 from RO2.85bn a year ago recording a growth of 18.95 per cent.
The bank's net loans advances and financing to customers showed a growth of 14.68 per cent to reach RO2.5bn as at end of June 2015 compared to RO2.18bn as at end of June 2014.
This growth in loans advances and financing was supported by a corresponding growth in the customer deposits which improved by 20.09 per cent to RO2.63bn as at end of June 2015 as against RO2.19bn a year ago.
Total operating income including the non-funded income such as fees and commissions foreign exchange profit investment income grew by 13.22 per cent to reach RO54.91mn during the period.
The bank's net provisions for loan and investment impairments increased to RO4.45mn year-to-date June 2015 as compared to RO3.05mn in the same period last year with impairment allowance of RO9 required for available-for-sale investments during first half of 2015.
BankDhofar said its Islamic banking window Maisarah Islamic Banking Services continued the trend of showing strong growth in assets customer deposits and profitability.
The total assets of Maisarah increased by 90.5 per cent to RO238.53mn at end of June 2015 from RO125.21mn at end of June 2014. Maisarah's gross financing portfolio grew from RO89.62mn at the end June 2014 to RO174.25mn at end of June 2015 recording a significant growth of 94.43 per cent. Customer deposits rose fivefold from RO26.96mn at end of June 2014 to RO144.29mn at June 2015.
BankDhofar said Maisarah's cost to income ratio has improved from 80.6 per cent at end of June 2014 to 46.75 per cent at end of June 2015 thus proving Maisarah's long term strategic efforts and commitment to manage cost and increase profitability for the benefit of all the stakeholders. During the first half of 2015 Maisarah recorded fivefold increase in net profit before tax of RO1.28mn compared to a net loss before tax of RO290000 during the corresponding period of 2014.
